alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 11:14PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Franklin, Crawford, south central Washington, northeastern Sequoyah and southern Adair Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1113 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Natural Dam, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Alma... Mulberry... Dyer... Chester... Rudy... Brushy... Devils Den State Park... Lake Fort Smith... Figure Five... Lee Creek... Bunch... Short... Piney... Uniontown... Locke... Odell... Mount Gayler... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 12 and 23. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
